snippet: The economy expanded by just 7.7 percent during the first three months of the year, compared with a year earlier, falling short of expectations.
abstract: Chinese economy expands by only 7.7 percent during first quarter of 2013, surprising analysts who had expected growth to accelerate on back of ample credit, strong infrastructure spending and firm exports.

byline.original: By BETTINA WASSENER and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: The economy expanded by just 7.7 percent during the first three months of the year, compared with a year earlier, falling short of expectations.

headline.seo: Chinese G.D.P. for First Quarter Shows Signs of Slowdown
headline.main: In Surprise, Recovery in China Loses Steam
headline.print_headline: In Surprise, Recovery In China Loses Steam
